content.prompt: Which statement about a blackbody is correct?

choices.label: A blackbody emits photons, each with a quantized amount of energy.
Radiation is absorbed, not emitted, by a blackbody when the temperature of the blackbody is lower than the temperature of the surroundings of the blackbody.
A blackbody can only emit photons that are of energies that correspond to the differences in the energy levels of a hydrogen atom.
The peak wavelength emitted by a blackbody increases with increasing temperature.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
